thread.title: Manuel Zamora
thread.title_full: Pelican Water Systems reviewed by Manuel Zamora

author: Manuel Zamora
title: Manuel Zamora
text:
Pelican NaturSoft Salt-Free Water Softener - As far as the the install process, had to use lots of different plumbing technologies due to my current house 1/2" copper pipe feed but not Pelicans issue.
After I did all the work, small leak between bottom chrome tank and head unit.
I emailed customer service, they told me due to shipping, may have come loose or due to install, the head unit might have become slightly loose. They told me to switch head unit to the bypass/off position and disconnect unit using supplied quick disconnects, tighten head a bit more since it is only hand tightened at factory. I held the bottom portion with my feet and tightened top head, connected unit back up, cleaned water residue and once old water residue evaporated, no more leaks. I might have tightened about slightly less than 3/4 turn from original position.
The install process used and reason for install...tankless water heater and needed to avoid the scale buildup on the unit since San Antonio is aquifer water supply so lots of calcium/hard water.
I used 1" PVC to get the pre-filter and conditioner parts fitting together, my main feed is 1/2" so upsized to 3/4" then to 1" to pre-filter ... then back down to 3/4", then to the 1/2" eventually.
